intro: Pentacalia rufohirsuta, commonly known as the red-hairy pentacalia, is a flowering plant native to South America, particularly Brazil. It belongs to the family Campanulaceae and is characterized by its hairy stems and small, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. Its leaves are opposite and often covered in fine, reddish hairs, contributing to its common name. The flowers are usually pale green to white, with a distinctive shape that attracts specific pollinators.
